decks.name: See Someone
prompts: Tell someone in the room something you've noticed about them but never said
Who here changed the most in the last year? Tell them what you see
Point at the person who would survive the longest in the wild. Explain
Look at the person to your left. What do they need to hear right now?
Who in this room do you think is hiding the most? Point at them
Give someone a compliment you'd normally only think
Who here do you think would be famous if they really tried? Why?
Pick someone. Describe their energy tonight in one word
Who in this room would you trust with a secret you've never told anyone?
Look at everyone. Who's carrying something heavy right now? You don't have to be right
Tell someone here what they're like when they don't think anyone's watching
Who in this group makes you feel the most calm? Announce them by name
Pick someone. What's a top memory you have with them?
If someone in this room wrote a book, whose would you actually read? What would it probably be about?
Who here has a talent they don't take seriously enough? Call them out then leave it alone!
Describe someone in this room using only three words. Let the group guess who
What do people get wrong about someone in this group. Don't say who and don't look at them
Pick someone. What do you think keeps them up at night?
If you had to send one person in this room to represent the group to aliens, who and why?
Tell someone what you admire about the way they handle hard things
Who here would you go to if everything fell apart tomorrow?
Pick someone. What would they be doing if money didn't exist?
Who in this room is most different from who they were five years ago?
Who in this group isn't seeing your vision right now? Say their name and continue
Tell someone what you think their superpower is
Look at everyone for 5 seconds each. Then say who looked the most uncomfortable being looked at
Pick someone. What do you think they were like as a kid?
Who here would you want beside you in an emergency? Tell them why
Look at someone. What do you think they need more of in their life?
Who here is the best listener? Don't all look at the same person
Pick someone. What's a version of them you've seen that others here probably haven't?
Who in this room has surprised you the most? Don't explain unless they ask
Tell someone what you think they're afraid of. Be gentle
Pick someone. If you had to describe them to a stranger in one sentence, what would you say?
Who here laughs the hardest at things that aren't that funny? What does that say about them?

decks.name: See Yourself
prompts: What's one thing you're avoiding right now?
Name a belief you held a year ago that you've quietly dropped
If nobody could judge you, not even the law, what would you do tomorrow?
What's something you're proud of that you never talk about?
Say something honest right now. About anything
What's a promise you will never break?
What is one thing 12-year-old you would say about your life right now?
If you could change one decision, which one?
What happened the last time you cried?
Name one thing you learned the hard way
What's something everyone assumes about you that isn't true?
If you could be remembered for one thing, what would it be?
Describe one thing about the version of yourself you're trying to become
If your life had a title right now, what would it be?
What do you wish you could tell your younger self?
What's one thing you want but are too embarrassed to admit?
Name a moment that changed the direction of your life
What's something you do that you know isn't good for you but you keep doing anyway?
If this is as good as it gets, would that be enough?
What's something you pretend to like but don't?
What's the most honest thing you could say right now?
Name a fear you've outgrown and one you haven't
What do you think people say about you when you leave the room?
What would you do with your life if you knew you couldn't fail?
What's something you need to forgive yourself for?
What's the bravest thing you've ever done?
When was the last time you felt completely free?
What's one thing you'd change about the way you were raised?
What are you most grateful for that you never talk about?

decks.name: See the Moment
prompts: Everyone close your eyes for 5 seconds. Open. What's the first thing you notice?
What sound can you hear right now that you weren't aware of 5 seconds ago?
Describe exactly what this room smells like
Look around. What's one thing in this space you've never noticed before?
Everyone be completely silent for 10 seconds. Then describe what you heard
Look at the ceiling. Describe it like you're seeing it for the first time
Without looking at a clock — what time do you think it is? Ask someone who isn't on their phone and if they are correct, you must grant them 1 wish
Name something beautiful that's within eyesight right now
What's the furthest thing you can see from where you're sitting?
What emotion is sitting in the room right now? Name it
What's the oldest thing in this room?
What would a stranger think if they walked in right now?
Close your eyes. Point to where you think north is. Open. Check. If correct, congratulations — you know North!
Right now — what are you most aware of that you weren't aware of when this game started?
Everyone take one deep breath together. What changed?
What's the temperature in this room? Not the number — describe how it feels
What's the vibe right now in one word? Everyone say it at the same time
Look at your hands. When was the last time you really looked at them?
What's one thing in this room that wasn't here a year ago?
If you could freeze this exact moment, would you? Why or why not?
Name something in this room that somebody chose carefully
What does the light look like right now? Describe it
Who looks the most relaxed right now? Who looks the least? Don't say it — just notice
What's one thing touching your skin right now that you weren't aware of?

decks.name: Wild Cards
prompts: Show the group a recent photo you took
Let someone answer a text message for you. Choose the text and your dear sender
Call someone you love. Speaker. Tell them one thing. If you veto this say: "I am bad at noticing right now" out loud
Show the group your screen time for today
Everyone write down a number between 1 and 100. See who's closest to each other. Now you know
Show the group your lock screen. Why that image?
Put your phone face down. Last person to pick theirs up wins respect
Show the group your last three searches. No deleting first
Everyone stand up. Arrange yourselves in order of how tired you are. No talking
Pick a song that matches the mood right now. Play 30 seconds of it
Show the group the last note you wrote on your phone
Tell the group your most controversial food opinion
Read aloud the last text you sent. No context
Go around the circle — everyone shares their phone battery percentage. The lowest tells a truth
Everyone point at who you think woke up the earliest today. Whoever gets the most points confirms or denies
Swap seats with someone. Don't explain why you picked them

decks.name: Late Night
prompts: What's a lie you've told that you never corrected?
If you could hear what one person in this room really thinks of you, who?
What's something you've never said to anyone in this room?
What do you think happens when we die?
What's the biggest thing you've forgiven someone for?
What's the loneliest you've ever felt?
Have you ever been in love with someone who didn't know?
What do you wish you could say to someone who's no longer in your life?
If you could relive one day of your life, which one?
What do you think your friends tolerate about you?
What's something you've never gotten over?
When was the last time you felt truly seen by someone?
What's something you know you should let go of but can't?
If you could have one conversation with anyone, living or dead, who and what would you say?
What are you most afraid of losing?
Is there someone you owe an apology you've never given?
What's a question you're afraid to know the answer to?
